website_summaries.verdict: Works nearly as effectively as others we reviewed, but at a lower price. The best deal you will find.
pros: Features an adjustable interior to fit a variety of bottles and accessories
Its slim design doesn't take up excessive space
cons: You have to allow 10 minutes of cool-down time in between multiple sterilizing sessions
It's somewhat more difficult to use than others we considered

customer_reviews.title: I bought in order to be in compliance with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought in order to be in compliance with a milk donation program, I followed all sanitation guidelines but still came back with higher than optimal bacteria levels. I returned this sanitizer and went to the stove top boiling method without changing anything else about my set up and had much lower bacteria levels. Making me think that this device wasn't doing what it claimed. Also, I didn't realize it until I used it, but this device does not dry bottles which is a bit disappointing. In my opinion, it's worth spending a little more on a sterilizer that also dries for just stick to the old fashioned method.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Link

customer_reviews.title: It should work with Voltage 220-240V as stated in the ...
customer_reviews.text: It should work with Voltage 220-240V as stated in the ad, but when i operate it with outlet 220V it breakdown, finally i noticed that it works only with 120V, as written on the device
customer_reviews.author: JOORY Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: The only bottle sterilizer I’ve ever had/used, so I don’t have much to compare it to. But I’m not really all that thrilled with it. The size and design (how you can use the large or small basket by itself) is nice, but you always have TONS of condensation after it runs the cycle. So much so that even when you take the bottles and things out after a few hours they are still wet and dripping. My counters are always soaked by the time I take everything out and empty out the remaining water in the bottom of the machine. Maybe this is how all sterilizers work? But I’m not really a fan of that part.
customer_reviews.author: kaitlinedowns

customer_reviews.title: Dr Browns Bottles do NOT fit
customer_reviews.text: This sanitizer doesn’t fit the Dr Browns 8oz bottles. That’s probably the most common bottle out there and the sanitizer about 1/2” too short. . Dr Browns 8oz bottle is almost identical in size to others out there as well so there must be a good amount of bottles that don’t fit. They really should specify that this only fits THEIR 11oz bottles and other standard 8oz bottles do not fit. Can’t help but wonder why this isn’t stated anywhere on the description that most 8oz bottles will NOT fit their machine. Safe to say that unless you use the Philips Avent bottles your going to be out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa_Hoosier

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed it just worked for 2 minutes!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this one and I thought it’s a good brand and good reviews already I have read all the instructions before the first use and as instructed I turned on for the first time but after 2 minutes it went off and I smelt bad smell and I waited like 5 minutes and I tried to many times to turn on again but it didn’t happened I searched for a solution online but i found some people have the same problem The power button not clicking any more and it’ not operating any more I was very disappointed since it was international shipping and amazon will not refund the shopping cost also i needed this to work
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Returned Item, slimy film after use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased after reading positive reviews on this product. I followed instructions and properly washed all pumping parts and bottles with warm soapy water prior to placement in steamer, filled with 100mL of water and still got a slimy film on all products after sterilization. I called company to ask if this was normal and they said "technically philips doesn't recommend any other bottles besides philips to be placed in sterilizer." I ended up returning this item and am currently boiling items until I can find a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Great large bottle, pump, toys sterilizer
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It minimizes cleaning time of baby things. It's simple and add water at the bottom and easy to clean! Easy to dump water out unlike other ones you have to empty the whole container out. Two tiered and each is deep enough for decent size items. Can use separately with each tier if you don't have enough for both levels. Really gets up to temperature ! Has light so you know when it's steaming and doesn't turn off til it's cooler than immediately done. Still hot but not burning to the touch .
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Leung-O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: It's been great for in between dishwasher cycles
customer_reviews.text: The quick run time has been great on days where we don't do a full load of dishes in the dishwasher. We can rinse out bottles and put in here and just a few minutes later they are sterile and ready for use. The only complaint is that we've had to buy distilled water to use with this as our tap water must have impurities that would build up on the heating surface. But it's been extremely valuable in not only cleaning bottles, but pacifiers and teething toys as well.
customer_reviews.author: The Fickerts

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: My husband just used it twice last Oct 2019 and after the third set of bottles cleaned we were unable to use it again. We safely handled it. We followed everything in the instructions and guides but still doesn’t work. We don’t know how to figure it out so we just placed it back inside it’s box/packaging. First and last used Oct 24, 2019. Can we still use the warranty? Returns are still possible up to this date? Send help!
customer_reviews.author: MaximusZeus

customer_reviews.title: Missing a piece....
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and assemble/dissemble. Way easier thank boiling bottles; nipples, and pump parts. Lightweight which is really important because I can move this and use it myself one week after a c section (but can’t yet lift a pot full of water to boil on a stove). It leaves everything sopping wet, which I knew from other reviews. The humidity in my house also means it takes hours and hours for anything to airdry so that’s a major inconvenience, but still easier than boiling. Biggest disappointment in this brand new box is the missing dishwasher basket for all the little parts!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Saves time
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use. Sanitizes in 6 mins. Only con is it doesnt dry the bottles. But that is listed on the product so its not the products fault. Just something i didnt realize could be important...we have a bottle holder to air dry bottles...but they only reason it bothers me is all the water falls back to the bottom or runs out when you go to open and pick the sections up
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Matteson

customer_reviews.title: Don't let your children get burned, or yourself
customer_reviews.text: They should be sued, and item recalled. It won't let me load my video of its non existent safety features. I burned myself, luckily it wasn't my baby!! I was simply plugging it in, and it was magically on already and I happened to touch the metal plate. The single "on button" is very dangerous and manual, so it turns on when the machine is off! So you think you're fine, and it's off, but you plug it in and it could already be on... Burn my children and burn my house down while you're at it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I remember purchasing this steamer last year on Amazon for around $40 now its at $75??!! Wth Its definitely not worth the $75 for that you might aswell get one with a built in Dryer too. Dont just settle for a sterilizer if you are going to waste $75 on a product. Theres bunch of other companies that offer more for $75 & less. Dont do it I warned you! I switched to the Eccomum and couldnt be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gennette Guzman

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: This item lasted a week before the bottom got burned and all my baby bottles Andrew nipples smelled burnt. We had to throw it away!! Very dissapointing. Within in 2 days we noticed the bottom tray where you put the water started to get rusty but we thought that was normal of course 5 days later it just was no longer usable. My husband and I thought it was a pretty cool item but little did we know it was not at all as expected. We do not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: ada

customer_reviews.title: No drying functionality
customer_reviews.text: With our first child we used the Wabi for sanitizing and drying. Since the Wabi randomly stopped working, we decided to replace it with this much cheaper option. The biggest issue is that it doesn’t dry, it seems to sanitize okay, but then there are tons of water droplets left in all of the items. The Wabi would sanitize and completely dry so you could put the bottle pieces away. With the avent, you’d need to put them on a drying rack which to me, voids the sanitizing! We will be returning about purchasing a new Wabi. I really wanted this to work out but the drier (or lack there of) is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: K B

customer_reviews.title: Cool product! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Its cool, we're very happy with the product and its doing what its intended to. I would definitely buy it for a friend or myself if needed. Now ther are a few flaws thst could be corrected easily, such as it should have a kind of sensor that disables it if there is no water in the reservoir. Also, if you hit the button by mistake the only way to turn it off is pulling the cord of the outlet. Meaning, you cant turn it off by hitting the button again. And that doesnt make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Furtado

customer_reviews.title: unsterilized bottles???
customer_reviews.text: The plan when i bought this was to share with my sis in law as i would have been staying with them after i had my baby. She had her baby 2 months before me. The set up of this is quick and easy to use, my issue with it was that to me the bottles after they had been sterilized still smelled of formula, sour formula. The bottles were always washed with detergent before being sterilized, however that smell always remained. I tried boiling the bottles, just to see, and the boiled bottles have no smell. So i have been boiling my bottles and this sterilizer is packed away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Descale not working
customer_reviews.text: System is good. Easy to travel with as it breaks down into 4 pieces. Cleaning it is easy to do but for ours we have been using it for a month, using only distilled water in it and its turning brown along one side. So per the instructions we are to descale it with vinager. We have been descaling it a couple times a week and the discoloring is not going away, just getting worse.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I used this steamer with my daughter 3 years ago and it lasted us throughout her infancy and toddler years. We ordered another one when I had my son 3.5 months ago and it stopped working. And we just missed the return window....disappointing! Cleaning is not that easy. You have to mix vinegar and water and let it steam. I still have to scrub it after to throughly clean it so I have to unplug it and make sure don’t get the plug wet.
customer_reviews.author: Melly Tillinghast

customer_reviews.title: Good sterilizer, but does not dry at all
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sterilizer and it does what it is supposed to do. However, it does not dry at all. I know it is not a dryer and I wouldn't expect it to dry right away like a dryer, but even if you take a bottle out of the sterilizer after 12+ hours, it still have vapor residue. It is somewhat annoying having to wipe each item dry individually before using it. I also wonder if the material of the bottle/nipple would deteriorate over time due to constant vapor residue. Just after 1 week of using it, the base is already dirty and will need treatment with vinegar regularly to maintain its cleanliness.
customer_reviews.author: Zeal Shah

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: Why would you want to sterilize your baby bottles in something that keeps them wet. Even when taking the bottles and putting them on drying rack they take like two days to dry. After 2-3 uses it was already rusting. I already ordered a different brand that has drying feature, much more practical, and less work for mom. What mom has time to wipe this machine dry after every use and clean the bottom with vinegar every week? So annoying.
customer_reviews.author: monique

customer_reviews.title: Not what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Product works but does not make your life easier. It actually creates more problem. Ones cycle finishes bottle is too hot so you leave them there. Go back there you have water from condensation, now it everywhere. Water gets around heating plate so you need to wipe it. It’s just so much work for very little benefit. Get one steam sanitizer for microwave same brand but much easier to use and no mess.
customer_reviews.author: David Y

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and clean, my mom got me this but I personally think you don't need it if you have already have a dishwasher since it cleans and disinfects everything for you. It is however very useful if you don't set the dishwasher every day, it disinfects everything super quickly and is great for pacifiers. I also use this for my pump and everything fits perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Emini A Luna

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: This fits all of the little parts to our bottles that I'm afraid we weren't washing clean enough. We have the Dr. Browns anti colic bottles and unfortunately the bottles themselves are too tall to fit inside the sanitizer but we can fit 12 sets of all the other parts of the bottle in one round of the steamer. It's incredibly hot, but such a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 8 oz bottle! Smells burned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the sole purpose of sterilizing my 8 oz bottles, because it claims to fit them. And it does... until you put the top on it to use it. It needs another half inch. So that is incorrect. They have to be laid on their side, so I feel like it’s not doing what it claims. Also it smells like burned plastic and makes anything that gets steamed smell burned. The bottom metal where the water goes turns brown with each use. The bottles seem more dirty after because of this. Wasted my money but didn’t use it enough when I first bought it to realize and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: YOU NEED IT
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely obsessed with this. This is an absolute must have for all parents. I load the bottles in there throughout the day and at night I start it and within minutes it’s done. I then put them on a drying rack for bottle which I also purchased from amazon and in the morning I assemble them and put them back away. I LOVE IT. I wish I purchased this before I had my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One button and done!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to operate. One button in the front, press it and forget it. With the busy life of being parents, we don't have time for fancy multi function devices. This is simple and straight to the point. No need to worry about the temperature and how long to boil the water. I use this everyday to clean his bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Tri Le

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Needs frequent cleanings.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sanitizer. We used the competitors sanitzer with our first child. That unit did not like how hard it was to clean, and ultimately stopped working after only 6 months. This unit is easy to take apart and clean. However it will have residue build up and a burning smell if not cleaned often. We have to frequently take apart the unit and throughly clean the bottom warming plate. This is better than previous sanitizers we have used.
customer_reviews.author: Angelique D

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love
customer_reviews.text: As a first time mom, I researched different brands of everything for everything. I really did end up loving this sterilizer because I works perfectly and gets the job done. I like that I am able to use different sizes, easily store away, mess free and the metal plate is easy to clean with vinegar.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Would have purchased a different one
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do but I wish there was a drying mechanism to it as the bottles stay wet until you hand dry them or purchase a bottle holder for them to dry on. Also, the silver pan that you fill with water gets dirty often, even though I wash the bottles first before I put them in the sterilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: Bottles Never Dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home for granddaughter. The bottles never dry and if you don't remove the bottles to either dry them or let them air dry, the moisture stays in the bottles for hours.
customer_reviews.author: DeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Faulty? Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: This product was great for about a month... Don't know why I’m having this problem. The water is changed after each use and yet it’s rusting? How on earth is this supposed to sterilize bottles when the container you’re supposed to put water in is rusting? Is there something wrong with mine or is this a typical occurrence with this product?
customer_reviews.author: Kait Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Best buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using steam bags in the microwave to sterilize my newborn's bottles and pumping parts but it was becoming tedious as the months went by because 1) I can only put a few pieces at a time, 2) I have to keep track of the # of times I'ved used it (the recommended limit is 20), 3) I'd burn my hands because I have to take those bags out of the microwave right away and 4) I have to spend so much time every day. Thankfully, I don't have to deal with those now and that's all thanks to this sterilizer. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Angel Lois Santiago

customer_reviews.title: USE YOUR INSTANT POT INSTEAD! Do not buy this toxic Polypropylene, off-gassing machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is made entirely of polypropylene, which has off-gassing of toxic VOC’s. We used this for our Philip’s Avent bottles for which this was designed. HOWEVER, this entire appliance is made of polypropylene. Which gets very hot when sterilizing. Therefore, all of your bottles and nipples WILL SMELL LIKE BURNING PLASTIC. AND THIS SMELL WILL NOT COME OUT OF YOUR NOW RUINED BOTTLES. Also consider that materials off-gas. God knows what chemicals off-gas when this thing gets hot. That smell and those gases directly contact the bottles and will NOT come off. Save your money! If you have an Instant Pot, (which you probably do) USE IT! Works great, all metal no burning plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Case

customer_reviews.title: Does a fine job of sterilizing bottles
customer_reviews.text: We been using this sterilizer for a month now is quite good and sturdy. We love the space it has for all kind of bottles and simplicity / sleek design for the unit. It does a fine job for a sterilizer and the only thing I do wish it had was a dryer too, along with the sterilizer, but otherwise it is a fine unit and would surely recommend this. We use this atleast 2 times a day for all kind of bottles, baby nipples, pacifiers, etc and then dry them out manually and it does the job. I would recommend this unit
customer_reviews.author: J V

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use .. but doesn’t last!
customer_reviews.text: This steamer was easy to use and worked great but the metal plate immediately started peeling and got so bad that it was putting rust/metal into the bottles and other pieces being steamed. Disappointed that this only lasted a couple months!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bowlin

customer_reviews.title: Get a sterilizer that dries the bottles, too.
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. Spend your money on a sterilizer that steams AND dries the bottles! It’s useless to sterilize the bottles only to have to hand dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Boarman

customer_reviews.title: Must've item when using bottle
customer_reviews.text: This steam sanitizer is the best purchase for our newborn. It is very easy to use and is actually quick and safe. I saw some other options like sanitizing using microwave but this actually feels better. Ten minutes and you have sanitized bottles ready for baby.
customer_reviews.author: parivesh sharma

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and definitely a must have for baby! Only thing for me personally is I need to figure out how to keep it clean from hard water- the heating element and bottom part of the sanitizer is stained. Also, I have the Dr. Brown bottles and sadly the 8oz bottles don't fit standing up.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Just meh. Everything is soaking wet after done...
customer_reviews.text: The best thing is that in 6 min the baby items are sterilized (supposedly). So it does the job, I guess, but I hate that everything is left soaked in moisture after its'd done (really bugs me). I also hate that the metal pan where you add water leaves a rusty looking residue (is it from over heating?), and needs cleaning. IMO The dishwasher does the job AND everything comes out dry. Save your money and counter space, this is something you can live without.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Must have item.
customer_reviews.text: Love that I can have 3 different heights for different items. Sanitized everything quick and easily without issues. After use you do have to wipe up the moisture and let it fully dry or you will get some of the issues others have mentioned. But it makes sanitizing bottles, pacifiers and breast pump supplies super fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Austin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used this thing several times a day (twin mom) and it worked really well. It's pretty tall but I wouldn't use the skinny dr.brown bottles with it. We used avent bottles and nuk. Both were fine in it
customer_reviews.author: Outnumberedmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Steamer
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is so quick, and it has a decent capacity. I really like having a separate compartment for smaller items such as bottle nipples. I have found that when mineral residue builds up on the heating element, I can simply use a plastic food scraper and a little water to get it right off! I really feel like everything gets sanitized, and I don’t mind drying it off because I have to put pieces back together anyway. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel F. Stone

customer_reviews.title: and it fits all parts nicely. It's compact and doesn't take up a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to sterilize my breast pump parts and it works perfectly. I use it in the smallest configuration, and it fits all parts nicely. It's compact and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. The only downside is if you are living in a place that has hard water, you have to use water bottles (can't use the tap) or else the hot pan will get a lot of scaling after just one use. It would also be nice if AVENT included a specific measuring cup, as my bottles are labeled via ounces, not mL.
customer_reviews.author: McWillis

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for new parents
customer_reviews.text: This is a great steam sterilizer for bottles which will save new parents a lot of time trying to cleaning up bottles thoroughly. There are 2 layers, the upper layers can be used for bottle nipples and covers while the lower layer can be used for bottles. It's really easy to use as we just have to add fill the water onto the heating pad (do not overfill) and turn on the sterilizer. The only place I don't like it is that there will be some mineral built up in around the heating element after a while and they are quite hard to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love this sanitizer
customer_reviews.text: It’s super easy to use and I like that you change up the sizing and it was be used 3 ways. I also like that although is Avent; it is pretty universal. I wouldn’t recommend it for on the go as it is kinda bulky but definitely an item to consider to have at home.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: The first one lasted about 7 months, on our second one now. With how many bottles that first one sterilized, it earned its weight in gold. Absolutely suggest buying one, and we will likely continue to buy this model as time passes as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Chanjin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, be cautious of the bottle you use
customer_reviews.text: it works as advertised. We used the small Dr. Brown bottles, at first. Switching to the large Dr. B bottles proved much more challenging. They are too tall, so you have to find a way to angle them. Plastic bubbles in the middle a bit, but i expected that, over time. I'm sure its perfect for the Avant bottles (because why wouldn't it?) just not for every brand size.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen F. Seigfrid

customer_reviews.title: Smells like plastic
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and i like the double decker style which allows to use just the top part if you need to sterilize only few items. I have been using this for 2 months but that rubbery plastic smell is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Lasata

customer_reviews.title: Great steam sterilizer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent sterilizer which gets a lot of wear and tear around our house. It does collect a lot of mineral deposits at the base after awhile but nothing a little vinegar can't get out. Overall it does it's job and is pretty easy to use for a great price. It can fit a lot of bottles and pump parts in it at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made to be portable,  but great product.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: seems that it would fit most bottles. I personally use gerber first essentials bottles. Generally easy to use. Cons: not really portable, but it can be. I recommend cleaning the water basin after every use. Even though it's a sterilizer, i recommend cleaning the whole unit that doesn't have a electric cord attached with hot soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: MommaG

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!! I only use comotomo bottles and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing!! I only use comotomo bottles and I can fit 6 (either small or big), while there is still plenty of room for pacifiers, the formula dispenser (those that stack on), etc... I like that you can use only one part if you need to sterilize a small amount of things... this could be a great baby shower gift and a must have for moms!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Garza

customer_reviews.title: Avent 3 in 1 steamer
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful steamer for my kids milk bottles. My wife love’s using using because we know that the bottle are clean and sterilized good. We also lend it to my friends when they have their baby born and they also love the steamer. Good quality and easy to use. They should make a bigger design for more bottles to fit in. It keeps the bottle warm also. It won’t disappoint you and easy to bring on trips. Price is about normal and in range with other same products.
customer_reviews.author: Ryann

customer_reviews.title: A good steamer
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Exercise care with the heating plate and you will not have any problems. Simply remove the water after every use or ensure all the water evaporates. Steaming time is short. Do not open the cover immediately after steaming to avoid burns.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Yarde

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The product offers fast sterilization, only about 15 minutes to load and steam. However, using it twice a day it only lasted 4 months. Also, bottles never dry. Microwavable bags are faster, cheaper and better in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Choco

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this sterilizer if you get it for the price advertised. I purchased my for around half of the MSRP, and at that price, it is a no-brainer compared with other sterilizers.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny & Tony

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: So quick and easy to use. Love it and the cost is affordable. I really wanted a sterilizer that did not require the microwave. I keep it right on the counter and it does take up that much space
customer_reviews.author: ScottJa

customer_reviews.title: USE DISTILLED  WATER
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I read that you need to use distilled water but I know the breeza does say it and it makes sense. The coil will burn the tap water in the first use and all the minerals will create a nasty brown looking sediment that won't come off no matter how much you clean it. Also, if you hit the bottom by mistake there's no way of shutting it off unless you unplug it from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big useful but gets dirty
customer_reviews.text: It can fit a lot of baby bottles. Like mentioned in other peoples review, the bottom gets rusty and had to use vinegar to clean it from time to time. vinegar really does the trick, i would add a little hot water along with the vinegar to speed up the process. Then just wipe and it comes off.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different sterilizer
customer_reviews.text: This product has multiple flaws. It leaks all over the counter. I had to have amazon replace it because Phillip Avent wouldn’t. It gets a nasty build up on the tray and the bottles still smell like milk and burnt water when they come out so I have to rewash then. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Bones

customer_reviews.title: It has very strong smell
customer_reviews.text: My sister-in-low has one she very happy with it. So I also give it a try. When I got my it has a very strong smell. We try to wash it few times, the smell were still there. We end up return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT.....
customer_reviews.text: I remember using this sterilizer (the old model) with my first baby & it worked great. This time around i was anxiously looking forward to using it again & honestly this new model seems harder to use, in the way that after every time you use it; you must take it apart to dry the access water (makes me feel like it will build up mildew if i don't dry it). I don't recommend this product. I suggest you search for another kind & read the reviews. i wish i would of done that!
customer_reviews.author: MARILYN MEDINA

customer_reviews.title: Avent...Always the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and used for both my kids worth 3 ages of difference...and guessed what? It still worked! Invest in an daily use appliance to work for years at this price, has no value! This is easy to manage and to clean (something you will appreciate!). I strongly recommend this product to whoever needs to sterilize any baby product.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd use this a lot more than I do. It works, but its a little confusing to use, and it is also large and not easy to store. It definitely works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I really love having this sterilizer. It's easy to use, and gives me piece of mind about my baby's health. For my last baby I tried a microwave sterilizing bag, but it didn't fit much, and I often burned my hands on the steam. This fits 6, eight ounce bottles easily, and I usually have some pacifiers in there as well. Always use distilled water to avoid residue build up. If needed, I just wipe it with some white vinegar and it cleans off any hard water stains.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daily sanitiation. A bit wet as you put everything away.
customer_reviews.text: We have the 3 in 1 and I cannot imagine needing the 4 and 1. I simply soak my bottle and pump parts in warm soapy water for 5 mins, rinse and then sanitize them with this. It's plenty big for my small apartment, but is way better than having to boil everything every day to sanitize. Go for the 3 in 1 is my recommendation. Knocked off a star because it's hard to put everything away without getting drips of water everywhere. There's always water left in the base when you're done.
customer_reviews.author: N Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Great product and a must if you have a little one.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take much time at all to sterilize products. I have been using it almost everyday for the past 2 weeks. It is convenient and super simple to operate. A must if you have a little one and only have a couple of things to wash. Just rinse items and set inside and push a button.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Rodriguez-Landry

customer_reviews.title: Great product but hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The product is super easy to use. Sterilizes the bottles in just 7 minutes. I can put up to 8 Dr. Brown bottles between the two compartments. If you don't have that many you can simply use the main compartment. To clean the compartments you can simply put it on the dishwasher. However, the metal plate that hats the water is extremely hard to clean. After a few uses it creates this brown residue that's very hard to clean. I haven't been able to find a way to completely clean without using harsh cleaning products.
customer_reviews.author: Yare

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This fits all of the little parts to our bottles that I'm afraid we weren't washing clean enough. We have the Dr. Browns anti colic bottles and unfortunately the bottles themselves are too tall to fit inside the sanitizer but we can fit 12 sets of all the other parts of the bottle in one round of the steamer. It's incredibly hot, but such a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Bampi  patel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Still working great after a year of use!
customer_reviews.text: This sterilizer is a great equipment. Plenty of space for bottles, pacifiers, pots, spoons, in one attempt you can sterilize a lot. I will say this is paramount as I tried some other other small sterilizer and just kept me busy putting in and out the stuff. And the price was the same by the way. With this one just fill the water, place the bulk of items, turn it on and forget about it it will shut down automatically when done. After a year of intensive use is still like new. This one will give you peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: David Jesús Pajón Espina

customer_reviews.title: Buy a bigger machine
customer_reviews.text: The bottle steralizer does his job. My only issue is now that my kid is older and uses an 8 oz bottle which do not fit in the machine. I wish I would have bought a bigger machine because 4 months later it is useless now just sitting in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Issass

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted for over a year!
customer_reviews.text: This sterilizer has been great! I actually have 2, one in my home and the other in my mothers house. I recommend it for anyone who is looking for a durable quick way to sterilize bottles and/or pacifiers. It is cheaper here than in the stores too. I am still using them although my daughter is now 15 month old. It's just so easy to use, I figure why not. It fits six bottles at a time even 7 if you try. I works in just 6 minutes (although you do have to give it a while to cool down). I had read some not so good reviews, but I have had no problems with this sterilizer and love it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Del Campo

customer_reviews.title: not even 4 months, and its malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: i completely expected the calcification problem that people had brought up previously, and so i clean it according to directions with vinegar regularly. but this last weekend the sensor or what not got so hot it melted the bottom basket! it's all brown and everything... my kitchen ended up smelling like burnt plastic!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael W.

customer_reviews.title: I really like the ease of this sanitizer
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ease of this sanitizer, it doesn't take long to work. My only complaint is how often you have to descale it. I use white vinegar and let it sit for about 5 minutes just about every day to get the stuff out. It looks like rust and I actually returned one because I thought it was rusting, but it was just scaling. You can fit a lot more bottles than it says in the bottom as well. I use this then stick all my stuff on a boon grass drying rack and find a load in the sanitizer fits well on the grass, returned the lawn as it was too large.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ferri

customer_reviews.title: Water reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Item was easy to put together, BUT once you place water in reservoir and started the sterilizing that's when everything didnt work for me. The water would burn in the reservoir and it would literally leave it burnt. The bottle would end up smelling like the burn. I'm not sure if I just got a defective one. Decided to return it instead
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: I dont t recommend this product. Is been 20 days of use and it’s already stained and the bottles are ending contaminated with that stain. I’m not sure this it’s the way a sterilised should work.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We use this steamer everyday! Be careful let it cool after running before getting into it, trapped steam is hot. Tells me it works very well, and it does. It gives my confidence in what im using for baby. This companied with drying rack is a grand mix in keeping and maintaining clean supplies for baby. An absolute must have if you dont have time for boiling. Fits a lot, get crafty with your tetris!
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Where are the bottles!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset!! I brought this product thinking I will have everything I need to sterilize bottles switch to my surprise there wasn't any bottles in the sterilizer it clearly states on the box there supposed to be six bottles and a bottle brush to clean the bottles which I did not receive now i have to buy bottle for my nephew very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: vanessia sanders

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This product is hands down amazing for sterilizing bsby bottles and pacifiers. Haven't had any issues with it and for the price of it cant complain very good product and very durable
customer_reviews.author: SuperMan

customer_reviews.title: Get an instapot
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, get an instapot. You can do 10 other things vs this expensive one function item. But it does what it says it does and the descriptions aren’t wrong. I just regret buying it. You can also boil water and do the same thing for free.
customer_reviews.author: Franchesca

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble and use. However the metal plate that is used to heat the water, have water stains, I tried the manual procedures to removed and it doesnt came off. Its not a big deal, It is still working (2 months of continuos use and keep going)
customer_reviews.author: Jackeline

customer_reviews.title: For daily use at home!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite tools! I use it daily! It’s very easy to use. I wish there was a way to clean the water stains from it (the machine itself). Every mommy needs one of these for their baby! It does the job in less than 15 min.
customer_reviews.author: Melquisedec Varela

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done
customer_reviews.text: I noticed our children were still use the product for their second child who was born in March 2020. They said they prefer to use it for sterilizing.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good machine and it gets the job done but I’m not happy with the rust that occurs at the bottom in the boiler after so many uses... I’m constantly washing this part down with bleach to be safe...
customer_reviews.author: Rachie R.

customer_reviews.title: REally Like This Thing
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with this sterilizer. The heat plate at the bottom will "rust" if it isn't cleaned and dried regularly. I use steel wool to clean off the build up, but I find that drying it completely with paper towels at least once a day is a real help.
customer_reviews.author: 416B

customer_reviews.title: Saves so much time!
customer_reviews.text: I think this was a great product and very convenient product but I feel some of the shipped pieces are faulty. I used it with my Philip's avent and tommie tippie bottles and they both fit. My product stopped working after the third use all on it's own and since I ordered this 4 months before the baby arrived, amazon would not offer me a replacement item. They offered me warranty information which was useless since I was also out of the country by the time the appliance stopped working. Maybe check and use it a couple of time to make sure if your product is working when it initially arrives
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lack drying
customer_reviews.text: It’s good quality and easy to use. But it has no drying function. It you use it, you still need to figure out how to dry the bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Received a used product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and paid for a new product. Received a used product in the mail. If it works, I’ll keep it (because as a new mother I don’t have time to return things), but I’m very unhappy to have Received a used product when paying for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C Schell

customer_reviews.title: The box is open before
customer_reviews.text: Hi, this Is my first time to use this sterilizer 3 in 1 avent philips and the avent vos was open not scotched and when i used for first time the blue bottom for on isn’t work easily like damaged. Even the bottles and the nipples were very wet with droplets of water there weren’t sterilided as much as I think. I like the avent product by the way and appreciate if you can help me. This order was Delivered at 07/29 while my banat was in NICU and I wasn’t open till today. Waiting for your response Best regards
customer_reviews.author: Nader

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the piece of mind this product gives. I have made this part of my nightly routine to sanitize anything used that day. The only thing I have negative to say is it left a weird smell on items the first few times using it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby feeding product
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same Avent Sterilizer for five years. We used it through our daughter's bottles and breast pump accessories and are using it again while fostering twins. We absolutely love this product! After boiling everything with our first born 14 years ago, I cannot express how much more convenient this sterilizer is. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: A must have !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing and very convenient for someone with a newborn .can sanitize and use the bottles as needed .will stay sterilized for 24 hrs
customer_reviews.author: robertandaida

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: I looked very nice. I returned it because I got some dr brown bottles and it didn’t fit in this sterilizer, I wished I would because I love this brand
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Bought twice. Broke down both times
customer_reviews.text: We bought this twice and it stopped working within a few days with the same problem. The button which starts the sterilizer stops working. Bought it first from amazon and it broke down within 24 hrs. We thought it was a bad unit so we bought another one from prime now. It arrived the same day and broke down within a month. Tried changing it to a different outlet but no use. Bad product
customer_reviews.author: monie2717

customer_reviews.title: recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for almost 3months.The machine is good and i think it better than the dr brown.Before i used the dr browm sterlize,i have to wait almost 15minutes.But this one,only 6 mintes and it warm up very fast.Save time.And it is very easy to clean.It can seperate as two parts.If you only want sterlize the nipple or the pacifier,you can only ise the top one.It is very convience for me,so i recmmend it.
customer_reviews.author: Karlie Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Large bottles (8oz) do not fit in the bottom. (You have to lean them in. Other than that it works great. You just need to be sure you clean out the bottom tray or it will have burn stains.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I did not like that it got rusty from the second use and maybe thinking of retiring it and the size is big. Other than that it’s good.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: yes buy it! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: yup worth it! At first I was a bit upset of the price but it's so easy to use better than boiling. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Estela

customer_reviews.title: Great steam sterilizer
customer_reviews.text: Color: WhiteTamaño: One Size This is a great steam sterilizer for bottles which will save new parents a lot of time trying to cleaning up bottles thoroughly. It's really easy to use as we just have to add fill the water onto the heating pad (do not overfill) and turn on the sterilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Héctor

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It does not dry the bottles after sterilizing them however. I also have the baby Brezza sanitizer. This one will sanitize more bottles/equipment etc at one time but does not dry them after the sanitize cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Philips Avent 3-in-1 Electric Steam Sterilizer for Baby Bottles, Pacifiers, Cups and More
product_meta.description:
The Philips Avent 3-in-1 Electric Steam Sterilizer SCF284/05 uses natural steam to kill 99.9% of germs and bacteria in just 6 minutes. Before sterilizing, wash items in warm, soapy water or the dishwasher. When they're clean, place them in the sterilizer. Fill the sterilizer basin with 100ml of water. Plug the sterilizer in to any standard electrical outlet and switch on. The sterilizing cycle will run for 6 minutes and then the sterilizer will automatically shut off for energy savings and safety. The 3-in-1 Electric Steam Sterilizer has an adjustable modular design. This gives you the option of using a small configuration for things like pacifiers, a medium configuration for breast pumps, toddler plates and utensils, or a large configuration for up to 6 Philips Avent bottles of any size. The sterilizer can be neatly tucked away on a countertop because it takes up minimal space in your kitchen. If the lid is unopened, contents will remain sterile and ready for their next use for up to 24 hours. The Philips Avent 3-in-1 Electric Steam Sterilizer is backed by a 2-year warranty.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Customer help-line at 1-800-542-8368
feature_bullets: Uses natural steam to sterilize baby bottles and other baby products, killing 99.9% of germs and bacteria without chemicals
Sterilizes in just 6 minutes; then automatically shuts off for energy savings and safety
3-in-1 adjustable modular design fits a variety of bottles, pacifiers, pumps and accessories and takes up minimal countertop space
Holds up to 6 Philips Avent bottles at once; compatible with both standard and wide neck bottles
Keeps contents sterile and ready for their next use for up to 24 hours if the lid is unopened
